text: Airline food is food served to passengers on an airplane. It is usually included in the price of the ticket, except for most low-cost airlines. Some airlines now have a buy-on-board menu, in which food and drinks are typically sold. Some airline now offer small snacks, instead of meals. ==Gallery== File:American Airlines.Airline meal.2005.jpg|First class airline food on American Airlines. File:Turkish Airlines service (1).jpg |A meal on Turkish Airlines. |Economy class snack box on Garuda Indonesia. File:Cashew nuts served on a Thai airways flight - economy class.JPG|Snack onboard Thai Airways. File:Gategourmet.jpg|Loading food on a SWISS plane. ==References== Category:Foods
title: Airline food
